NaiveBroadphase.name: NaiveBroadphase
NaiveBroadphase.description: Naive broadphase implementation. Does N^2 tests.

Narrowphase.name: Narrowphase
Narrowphase.description: Narrowphase. Creates contacts and friction given shapes and transforms.

Ray.name: Ray
Ray.description: A line with a start and end point that is used to intersect shapes. For an example, see {{#crossLink "World/raycast:method"}}World.raycast{{/crossLink}}

RaycastResult.name: RaycastResult
RaycastResult.description: Storage for Ray casting hit data.

SAPBroadphase.name: SAPBroadphase
SAPBroadphase.description: Sweep and prune broadphase along one axis.

DistanceConstraint.name: DistanceConstraint
DistanceConstraint.description: Constraint that tries to keep the distance between two bodies constant.
DistanceConstraint.author: schteppe

props.name: distance
props.description: The distance to keep between the anchor points. Defaults to the current distance between the bodies.

props.name: localAnchorA] The anchor point for bodyA, defined locally in bodyA frame. Defaults to [0,0
localAnchorB] The anchor point for bodyB, defined locally in bodyB frame. Defaults to [0,0
maxForce
props.description: Maximum force to apply.

GearConstraint.name: GearConstraint
GearConstraint.description: Constrains the angle of two bodies to each other to be equal. If a gear ratio is not one, the angle of bodyA must be a multiple of the angle of bodyB.
GearConstraint.author: schteppe

props.name: angle
props.description: Relative angle between the bodies. Will be set to the current angle between the bodies (the gear ratio is accounted for).

props.name: ratio
props.description: Gear ratio.

props.name: maxTorque
props.description: Maximum torque to apply.

example:
var constraint = new GearConstraint(bodyA, bodyB);
    world.addConstraint(constraint);

LockConstraint.name: LockConstraint
LockConstraint.description: Locks the relative position and rotation between two bodies.
LockConstraint.author: schteppe

props.name: localOffsetB
props.description: The offset of bodyB in bodyA's frame. If not given the offset is computed from current positions.

props.name: localAngleB
props.description: The angle of bodyB in bodyA's frame. If not given, the angle is computed from current angles.

PrismaticConstraint.name: PrismaticConstraint
PrismaticConstraint.description: Constraint that only allows bodies to move along a line, relative to each other. See this tutorial. Also called "slider constraint".
PrismaticConstraint.author: schteppe

props.name: maxForce
props.description: Max force to be applied by the constraint

props.name: localAnchorA
props.description: Body A's anchor point, defined in its own local frame.

props.name: localAnchorB
props.description: Body B's anchor point, defined in its own local frame.

props.name: localAxisA
props.description: An axis, defined in body A frame, that body B's anchor point may slide along.

props.name: disableRotationalLock
props.description: If set to true, bodyB will be free to rotate around its anchor point.

todo: Ability to create using only a point and a worldAxis

RevoluteConstraint.name: RevoluteConstraint
RevoluteConstraint.description: Connects two bodies at given offset points, letting them rotate relative to each other around this point.
RevoluteConstraint.author: schteppe

props.name: worldPivot
props.description: A pivot point given in world coordinates. If specified, localPivotA and localPivotB are automatically computed from this value.

props.name: localPivotA
props.description: The point relative to the center of mass of bodyA which bodyA is constrained to.

props.name: localPivotB
props.description: See localPivotA.

props.name: maxForce
props.description: The maximum force that should be applied to constrain the bodies.

AngleLockEquation.name: AngleLockEquation
AngleLockEquation.description: Locks the relative angle between two bodies. The constraint tries to keep the dot product between two vectors, local in each body, to zero. The local angle in body i is a parameter.

props.name: angle
props.description: Angle to add to the local vector in body A.

props.name: ratio
props.description: Gear ratio

ContactEquation.name: ContactEquation
ContactEquation.description: Non-penetration constraint equation. Tries to make the contactPointA and contactPointB vectors coincide, while keeping the applied force repulsive.

params.name: bodyA
params.description: First body participating in the equation

params.name: bodyB
params.description: Second body participating in the equation

params.name: minForce
params.description: Minimum force to apply. Default: -Number.MAX_VALUE

params.name: maxForce
params.description: Maximum force to apply. Default: Number.MAX_VALUE

FrictionEquation.name: FrictionEquation
FrictionEquation.description: Constrains the slipping in a contact along a tangent

RotationalLockEquation.name: RotationalLockEquation
RotationalLockEquation.description: Locks the relative angle between two bodies. The constraint tries to keep the dot product between two vectors, local in each body, to zero. The local angle in body i is a parameter.

props.name: angle
props.description: Angle to add to the local vector in bodyA.

RotationalVelocityEquation.name: RotationalVelocityEquation
RotationalVelocityEquation.description: Syncs rotational velocity of two bodies, or sets a relative velocity (motor).

EventEmitter.name: EventEmitter
EventEmitter.description: Base class for objects that dispatches events.

ContactMaterial.name: ContactMaterial
ContactMaterial.description: Defines what happens when two materials meet, such as what friction coefficient to use. You can also set other things such as restitution, surface velocity and constraint parameters.

props.name: friction
props.description: Friction coefficient.

props.name: restitution
props.description: Restitution coefficient aka "bounciness".

props.name: stiffness
props.description: ContactEquation stiffness.

props.name: relaxation
props.description: ContactEquation relaxation.

props.name: frictionStiffness
props.description: FrictionEquation stiffness.

props.name: frictionRelaxation
props.description: FrictionEquation relaxation.

props.name: surfaceVelocity
props.description: Surface velocity.

ContactMaterial.author: schteppe

params.name: id
params.description: Material identifier

vec2.name: vec2
vec2.description: The vec2 object from glMatrix, with some extensions and some removed methods. See http://glmatrix.net.

Body.name: Body
Body.description:
A rigid body. Has got a center of mass, position, velocity and a number of
shapes that are used for collisions.

props.name: mass
props.description: A number >= 0. If zero, the .type will be set to Body.STATIC.

LinearSpring.name: LinearSpring
LinearSpring.description:
A spring, connecting two bodies.

The Spring explicitly adds force and angularForce to the bodies.

props.name: restLength
props.description: A number > 0. Default is the current distance between the world anchor points.

props.name: stiffness
props.description: Spring constant (see Hookes Law). A number >= 0.

props.name: damping
props.description: A number >= 0. Default: 1

props.name: worldAnchorA
props.description: Where to hook the spring to body A, in world coordinates. Overrides the option "localAnchorA" if given.

props.name: localAnchorA
props.description: Where to hook the spring to body A, in local body coordinates. Defaults to the body center.

RotationalSpring.name: RotationalSpring
RotationalSpring.description:
A rotational spring, connecting two bodies rotation. This spring explicitly adds angularForce (torque) to the bodies.

The spring can be combined with a {{#crossLink "RevoluteConstraint"}}{{/crossLink}} to make, for example, a mouse trap.

props.name: restAngle
props.description: The relative angle of bodies at which the spring is at rest. If not given, it's set to the current relative angle between the bodies.

props.name: stiffness
props.description: Spring constant (see Hookes Law). A number >= 0.

props.name: damping
props.description: A number >= 0.

Spring.name: Spring
Spring.description: A spring, connecting two bodies. The Spring explicitly adds force and angularForce to the bodies and does therefore not put load on the constraint solver.

props.name: stiffness
props.description: Spring constant (see Hookes Law). A number >= 0.

props.name: damping
props.description: A number >= 0. Default: 1

props.name: localAnchorA
props.description: Where to hook the spring to body A, in local body coordinates. Defaults to the body center.

props.name: worldAnchorA
props.description: Where to hook the spring to body A, in world coordinates. Overrides the option "localAnchorA" if given.

TopDownVehicle.name: TopDownVehicle

params.name: chassisBody
params.description: A dynamic body, already added to the world.

props.name: localForwardVector
props.description: The local wheel forward vector in local body space. Default is zero.

props.name: localPosition
props.description: The local position of the wheen in the chassis body. Default is zero - the center of the body.

props.name: sideFriction
props.description: The max friction force in the sideways direction.

params.name: options
params.description: (Note that this options object will be passed on to the {{#crossLink "Shape"}}{{/crossLink}} constructor.)

props.name: width
props.description: Total width of the box

props.name: height
props.description: Total height of the box

Capsule.name: Capsule

params.name: options
params.description: (Note that this options object will be passed on to the {{#crossLink "Shape"}}{{/crossLink}} constructor.)

props.name: length
props.description: The distance between the end points

props.name: radius
props.description: Radius of the capsule

Circle.name: Circle

params.name: options
params.description: (Note that this options object will be passed on to the {{#crossLink "Shape"}}{{/crossLink}} constructor.)

props.name: radius
props.description: The radius of this circle

example:
var circleShape = new Circle({ radius: 1 });
    body.addShape(circleShape);

Convex.name: Convex

params.name: options
params.description: (Note that this options object will be passed on to the {{#crossLink "Shape"}}{{/crossLink}} constructor.)

props.name: vertices
props.description: An array of vertices that span this shape. Vertices are given in counter-clockwise (CCW) direction.

props.name: axes
props.description: An array of unit length vectors, representing the symmetry axes in the convex.

Heightfield.name: Heightfield
Heightfield.description: Heightfield shape class. Height data is given as an array. These data points are spread out evenly with a distance "elementWidth".

params.name: options
params.description: (Note that this options object will be passed on to the {{#crossLink "Shape"}}{{/crossLink}} constructor.)

props.name: heights
props.description: An array of Y values that will be used to construct the terrain.

props.name: minValue
props.description: Minimum value of the data points in the data array. Will be computed automatically if not given.

props.name: maxValue
props.description: Maximum value.

props.name: elementWidth
props.description: World spacing between the data points in X direction.

todo: Should use a scale property with X and Y direction instead of just elementWidth

Line.name: Line
Line.description: Line shape class. The line shape is along the x direction, and stretches from [-length/2, 0] to [length/2,0].

params.name: options
params.description: (Note that this options object will be passed on to the {{#crossLink "Shape"}}{{/crossLink}} constructor.)

props.name: length
props.description: The total length of the line

params.name: options
params.description: (Note that this options object will be passed on to the {{#crossLink "Shape"}}{{/crossLink}} constructor.)

Plane.name: Plane
Plane.description: Plane shape class. The plane is facing in the Y direction.

params.name: options
params.description: (Note that this options object will be passed on to the {{#crossLink "Shape"}}{{/crossLink}} constructor.)

OverlapKeeper.name: OverlapKeeper
OverlapKeeper.description: Keeps track of overlaps in the current state and the last step state.

OverlapKeeperRecord.name: OverlapKeeperRecord
OverlapKeeperRecord.description: Overlap data container for the OverlapKeeper

Island.name: Island
Island.description: An island of bodies connected with equations.

IslandManager.name: IslandManager
IslandManager.description: Splits the system of bodies and equations into independent islands

IslandNode.name: IslandNode
IslandNode.description: Holds a body and keeps track of some additional properties needed for graph traversal.

World.name: World
World.description: The dynamics world, where all bodies and constraints live.

props.name: solver
props.description: Defaults to GSSolver.

props.name: gravity
props.description: Defaults to y=-9.78.

props.name: broadphase

classitems.description: Friction coefficient to use in the contact of these two materials. Friction = 0 will make the involved objects super slippery, and friction = 1 will make it much less slippery. A friction coefficient larger than 1 will allow for very large friction forces, which can be convenient for preventing car tires not slip on the ground.
classitems.name: friction

classitems.description: Restitution, or "bounciness" to use in the contact of these two materials. A restitution of 0 will make no bounce, while restitution=1 will approximately bounce back with the same velocity the object came with.
classitems.name: restitution

classitems.description: Hardness of the contact. Less stiffness will make the objects penetrate more, and will make the contact act more like a spring than a contact force. Default value is {{#crossLink "Equation/DEFAULT_STIFFNESS:property"}}Equation.DEFAULT_STIFFNESS{{/crossLink}}.
classitems.name: stiffness

classitems.description: Relaxation of the resulting ContactEquation that this ContactMaterial generate. Default value is {{#crossLink "Equation/DEFAULT_RELAXATION:property"}}Equation.DEFAULT_RELAXATION{{/crossLink}}.
classitems.name: relaxation

classitems.description: Stiffness of the resulting friction force. For most cases, the value of this property should be a large number. I cannot think of any case where you would want less frictionStiffness. Default value is {{#crossLink "Equation/DEFAULT_STIFFNESS:property"}}Equation.DEFAULT_STIFFNESS{{/crossLink}}.
classitems.name: frictionStiffness

classitems.description: Relaxation of the resulting friction force. The default value should be good for most simulations. Default value is {{#crossLink "Equation/DEFAULT_RELAXATION:property"}}Equation.DEFAULT_RELAXATION{{/crossLink}}.
classitems.name: frictionRelaxation

classitems.description: Will add surface velocity to this material. If bodyA rests on top if bodyB, and the surface velocity is positive, bodyA will slide to the right.
classitems.name: surfaceVelocity

classitems.description: Offset to be set on ContactEquations. A positive value will make the bodies penetrate more into each other. Can be useful in scenes where contacts need to be more persistent, for example when stacking. Aka "cure for nervous contacts".

classitems.description:
The type of motion this body has. Should be one of: {{#crossLink "Body/STATIC:property"}}Body.STATIC{{/crossLink}}, {{#crossLink "Body/DYNAMIC:property"}}Body.DYNAMIC{{/crossLink}} and {{#crossLink "Body/KINEMATIC:property"}}Body.KINEMATIC{{/crossLink}}.

* Static bodies do not move, and they do not respond to forces or collision.
* Dynamic bodies body can move and respond to collisions and forces.
* Kinematic bodies only moves according to its .velocity, and does not respond to collisions or force.
classitems.name: type

classitems.description: Bounding circle radius.
classitems.name: boundingRadius

classitems.description: Bounding box of this body.
classitems.name: aabb

classitems.description: Indicates if the AABB needs update. Update it with {{#crossLink "Body/updateAABB:method"}}.updateAABB(){{/crossLink}}.
classitems.name: aabbNeedsUpdate

classitems.description: If true, the body will automatically fall to sleep. Note that you need to enable sleeping in the {{#crossLink "World"}}{{/crossLink}} before anything will happen.
classitems.name: allowSleep

classitems.description:
One of {{#crossLink "Body/AWAKE:property"}}Body.AWAKE{{/crossLink}}, {{#crossLink "Body/SLEEPY:property"}}Body.SLEEPY{{/crossLink}} and {{#crossLink "Body/SLEEPING:property"}}Body.SLEEPING{{/crossLink}}.

The body is initially Body.AWAKE. If its velocity norm is below .sleepSpeedLimit, the sleepState will become Body.SLEEPY. If the body continues to be Body.SLEEPY for .sleepTimeLimit seconds, it will fall asleep (Body.SLEEPY).
classitems.name: sleepState

classitems.description: If the speed (the norm of the velocity) is smaller than this value, the body is considered sleepy.
classitems.name: sleepSpeedLimit

classitems.description: If the body has been sleepy for this sleepTimeLimit seconds, it is considered sleeping.
classitems.name: sleepTimeLimit

classitems.description: Gravity scaling factor. If you want the body to ignore gravity, set this to zero. If you want to reverse gravity, set it to -1.
classitems.name: gravityScale

classitems.description: Whether to produce contact forces when in contact with other bodies. Note that contacts will be generated, but they will be disabled. That means that this body will move through other bodies, but it will still trigger contact events, etc.
classitems.name: collisionResponse

classitems.description: How long the body has been sleeping.
classitems.name: idleTime

classitems.description: The last time when the body went to SLEEPY state.
classitems.name: timeLastSleepy

classitems.description: If the body speed exceeds this threshold, CCD (continuous collision detection) will be enabled. Set it to a negative number to disable CCD completely for this body.
classitems.name: ccdSpeedThreshold

classitems.description: The number of iterations that should be used when searching for the time of impact during CCD. A larger number will assure that there's a small penetration on CCD collision, but a small number will give more performance.
classitems.name: ccdIterations

Updates .inertia, .invMass, .invInertia for this Body. Should be called when
changing the structure or mass of the Body.

example:
body.mass += 1;

classitems.description: The max number of iterations to do when solving. More gives better results, but is more expensive.
classitems.name: iterations

classitems.description: The error tolerance, per constraint. If the total error is below this limit, the solver will stop iterating. Set to zero for as good solution as possible, but to something larger than zero to make computations faster.
classitems.name: tolerance

classitems.description: Set to true to set all right hand side terms to zero when solving. Can be handy for a few applications.
classitems.name: useZeroRHS

classitems.description:
Number of solver iterations that are used to approximate normal forces used for friction (F_friction = mu * F_normal). These friction forces will override any other friction forces that are set. If you set frictionIterations = 0, then this feature will be disabled.

Use only frictionIterations > 0 if the approximated normal force (F_normal = mass * gravity) is not good enough. Examples of where it can happen is in space games where gravity is zero, or in tall stacks where the normal force is large at bottom but small at top.
classitems.name: frictionIterations

classitems.description: The number of iterations that were made during the last solve. If .tolerance is zero, this value will always be equal to .iterations, but if .tolerance is larger than zero, and the solver can quit early, then this number will be somewhere between 1 and .iterations.
classitems.name: usedIterations

classitems.description:
How to deactivate bodies during simulation. Possible modes are: {{#crossLink "World/NO_SLEEPING:property"}}World.NO_SLEEPING{{/crossLink}}, {{#crossLink "World/BODY_SLEEPING:property"}}World.BODY_SLEEPING{{/crossLink}} and {{#crossLink "World/ISLAND_SLEEPING:property"}}World.ISLAND_SLEEPING{{/crossLink}}.
If sleeping is enabled, you might need to {{#crossLink "Body/wakeUp:method"}}wake up{{/crossLink}} the bodies if they fall asleep when they shouldn't. If you want to enable sleeping in the world, but want to disable it for a particular body, see {{#crossLink "Body/allowSleep:property"}}Body.allowSleep{{/crossLink}}.
classitems.name: sleepMode

classitems.description:
Step the physics world forward in time.

There are two modes. The simple mode is fixed timestepping without interpolation. In this case you only use the first argument. The second case uses interpolation. In that you also provide the time since the function was last used, as well as the maximum fixed timesteps to take.

params.description: The fixed time step size to use.

params.description: The time elapsed since the function was last called.

params.description: Maximum number of fixed steps to take per function call.
